meanings.definition: Of or relating to an autocrat.
meanings.sent1: The autocratical ruler made all the decisions without consulting anyone else.
meanings.sent2: Her autocratical behavior alienated her colleagues and caused tension in the office.
meanings.sent3: The autocratical cat insisted on being fed at exactly the same time every day.
meanings.sent4: The autocratical storm clouds darkened the sky, signaling an impending downpour.
meanings.sent5: The autocratical teacher demanded strict adherence to the classroom rules.

meanings.sent1: The autocratical regime suppressed any form of dissent or opposition.
meanings.sent2: His autocratical leadership style left no room for input from his team members.
meanings.sent3: The autocratical toddler insisted on having his favorite toy at all times.
meanings.sent4: The autocratical mountain dominated the landscape, casting a shadow over the valley.
meanings.sent5: The autocratical boss expected unwavering obedience from his employees.

meanings.definition: Exercising power in an autocratic manner.
meanings.sent1: The autocratical mayor made unilateral decisions without consulting the city council.
meanings.sent2: The autocratical CEO ruled the company with an iron fist, leaving no room for discussion.
meanings.sent3: The autocratical referee strictly enforced the rules of the game, much to the players' dismay.
meanings.sent4: The autocratical sun blazed down on the desert, scorching everything in its path.
meanings.sent5: The autocratical landlord imposed arbitrary rules on the tenants, causing frustration and resentment.
